generalInfo:
19-day adventure through Colombia's most captivating destinations! Your journey begins in Bogotá, where you'll delve into the city's fascinating history and culture. Marvel at the stunning colonial architecture of the Candelaria district and explore the renowned Gold Museum. Take in panoramic views of the city from atop Monserrate, and venture outside of the city to visit the breathtaking Salt Cathedral of Zipaquirá and the charming town of Raquir to go to Villa de Leyva.

After an overnight stay in the picturesque colonial town of Villa de Leyva, we'll return to Bogotá to catch a flight to the Coffee Zone. You'll be taken to breathtaking Cocora Valley, where you'll marvel at the towering wax palms and soak in the stunning scenery. Then, we'll visit the charming town of Filandia, known for its vibrant colors and quaint cafes. Next, indulge in a coffee tour in Salento, where you'll learn about Colombia's renowned coffee culture and savor some of the world's finest coffee. From there, we'll continue our journey to Santa Marta.

From there, we'll journey to the lush mountain town of Minca, nestled in the Sierra Nevada mountain range. Take in the stunning scenery and explore the waterfalls.

Next, we'll head to the stunning Cabo San Juan beach in Tayrona National Park. Bask in the sun on pristine white sands, swim in crystal-clear waters, and explore the park's lush jungle trails. Then, we'll visit Taironaka, a fascinating archaeological site that tells the story of the Tayrona people who once lived here.

Your journey ends in Cartagena, where you'll explore the colonial charm of Cartagena with a city tour and visit the historic Getsemani neighborhood. Discover the vibrant Bazurto Market and take a sunset cruise along the coast. Finally, relax on the beautiful Rosario Islands before concluding your journey with memories to last a lifetime..

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Bogotá - Arrive at any time to be collected from the airport and taken to your accommodation. Depending on your arrival time we can provide you with another tour or with suggestions of places to see and where to go. Be sure to drink plenty of water to help you adapt to the altitude. (Overnight Bogotá)

Explore the historic heart of Bogotá on a guided excursion through La Candelaria, taking in important landmarks such as Bolivar Plaza, the Palace of Justice and the Catedral Primada de Colombia. After strolling through the incredible El Museo del Oro, you'll ascend to the summit of Monserrate, learning about the mountain's significance to the indigenous Musica people and enjoying stunning views of Bogotá from 10,341 ft (3152m) above sea level. (Overnight Bogotá)

Explore the Salt Cathedral of Zipaquira, the artisan town of Raquira, and the colonial town of Villa de Leyva on a 9-hour tour. See the incredible church made from an ancient salt mine, shop for Colombian-made artisanal goods, and experience the charm of a historic town. (Overnight Villa de Leyva)

Stroll through the beautiful cobblestone streets, visit the Monasterio Del Santo Eccehomo built in 1620, see the Terracotta House (the largest piece of pottery in the world), and visit the Fossil Museum where you can meet and touch the dinosaurs that roamed the area millions of years ago. After your tour of Villa de Leyva, you will start your journey back to Bogotá with a stop at El Puente de Boyacá, the site of the final battle for independence from Spain. (Overnight in Bogotá)
Enjoy a short flight to Pereira where your transport will be waiting to take you directly to your hotel in Salento. (Overnight Salento) Optional tour: Thermal pools of Santa Rosa

After breakfast, embark on a trip to the lush Cocora Valley for a guided tour of the Wax Palm Forest. Marvel at the tallest wax palms in the world and take in the breathtaking views of the valley. Spend a few hours walking through this peaceful zone and immerse yourself in the natural beauty of the area. Next, travel to the colorful town of Filandia, known for its delicious gastronomy, wonderful Colombian culture, and fabulous views. Stop for lunch at one of the many fantastic restaurants and take a walking tour to capture photos of the beautiful buildings. Visit the mirador (lookout) for spectacular 360-degree views of the town and its surroundings. (Overnight in Salento)

Start your day with an unforgettable coffee tour that is considered one of the best in Colombia. This tour is unique because the single lady owner has created a Finca that is completely pesticide and machinery-free, with every part of the process done by hand. Discover the traditional methods of growing the perfect coffee bean and explore the wonderful Finca where you'll find a large variety of fruits growing alongside the coffee plants. Learn the complete process from the seed to the cup, including handpicking a few beans yourself. Take an afternoon flight to Medellin (Overnight Medellin)

Start your day at 8 am with a cable car ride over Comuna 13, a street art district and home to displaced people. Ride the world's first outdoor escalators and learn about graffiti's meanings. Afterward, enjoy a fruit tasting at Plaza la America and visit Parques del Río, featuring a unique sculpture by Swiss artist Ugo Rondinone. Experience the Barefoot Park's sensory pathways, visit important heritage buildings, and see Fernando Botero's sculptures at Botero Plaza. The tour ends at Parque Memorial Inflexion, a memorial park honoring victims of narcoterrorism. The tour finishes at 3:30 pm, giving you the rest of the day to explore Medellin. (Overnight Medellin)

You'll be taken on a scenic drive through Antioquia to Guatape Rock. You'll have the opportunity to climb the 740 steps to the top for breathtaking views. You'll also visit Guatape town, known as the City of Zocalos, where you'll walk the streets, visit the main square, and maybe even take a tuk-tuk ride. Finally, you'll check in to the Guatape Hotel for some well-deserved rest. (Overnight Guatape)

Your day will start at 7 am and you'll be taken to a Cocoa Finca near San Rafael, where you'll have a delicious breakfast and explore the cocoa plantation on an easy hike. Along the way, you'll encounter tropical birds and Marmoset monkeys. After the hike, you'll enjoy a traditional lunch called a Fiambre and learn how to make chocolate using a traditional artisan method. You'll then get to create your very own chocolate bar with your choice of mixes and nuts. The tour continues with a swim in the Arenales River and an exfoliation using a mixture of fresh chocolate and the husk of the cocoa bean. Finally, you'll be transported back to your hotel with unforgettable memories of this Colombian adventure. (Overnight Medellin)
Free Day or an Optional tour of Jerico. (Overnight Medellin)

Enjoy a short flight to Santa Marta arriving around mid-afternoon. Your transport will be waiting to collect you and take you directly to your hotel. There are no activities planned for this day, so just relax, drink plenty of bottled water (it's hot here), and maybe check out a beach nearby. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Minca, is a charming town nestled in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, is just a short distance away from Santa Marta. The town boasts a cooler climate than the coast, so don't forget to pack a jumper for the fresh mountain nights. During your visit, you'll be surrounded by lush mountains, tropical forests, walking tracks, hidden waterfalls, beautiful views, and the simple living of the mountain life. There are many exciting things to do in Minca. You can go trekking on the many walking tracks that range from a couple of hours to a full day, where you'll discover some beautiful locations that will take your breath away. Take a dip in one of the many hidden waterfalls, such as Marinka Falls, and enjoy the cool, refreshing water. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Explore the stunning mix of tropical jungle, white sands, and Caribbean blue ocean at Cabo San Juan in Tayrona Park. Enjoy a 2-hour ecological walk through the jungle, visit 4 beaches, and indulge in 3 hours of beach time with optional watersports like snorkeling. Learn about the local environment, animals, and indigenous people on your walk with a knowledgeable guide (Overnight Santa Marta)

You'll start your adventure at 8 am from your Santa Marta hotel and drive for 1.5 hours to Rio Don Diego. After a 15-minute boat ride, you'll reach Tayronaka where you'll explore ancient ruins and a museum for about an hour with a guide. You'll also meet the Kogui community and receive an "aseguranza" to safeguard your future travels. After lunch, you'll kayak, paddleboard, or float down the river before relaxing on the beach and watching the sunset. You'll return to your hotel in the evening. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Relax in a morning drive along the coast to your waiting hotel in Cartagena. Once here you’ll check into your hotel and enjoy some Free Time before your 4pm city tour. You'll explore the charming colonial streets, plazas, restaurants, cafes, and bars within the walled city, along with one of the oldest and most bohemian neighborhoods in Cartagena. Visit the iconic landmarks such as the Clock Tower monument, Bolivar Park, Plaza Saint Pedro Claver, Plaza de Los Jagüeyes, San Diego, and the colorful streets of Gertsemani while learning about the city's historic struggle between the Spanish colonialists and pirates from different nations. (Overnight Cartagena)

Enjoy a wonderful ocean cruise on a speedboat to the Rosario Islands; arriving at a beautiful picturesque beach for a typical Caribbean lunch, crystal clear waters, water-sports, white sands, and palm trees. You'll be assigned your personal beach space which will be exclusive for yourself and members of your group. (Overnight Cartagena)

Explore the vibrant streets and graffiti-filled neighborhoods of Cartagena with a bilingual guide, discovering hidden cafes, bars, and restaurants. Then, venture into the bustling Colombian markets of Bazurto, where you'll learn about the daily lives of hard-working Colombians and sample exotic tropical fruits and freshly cut meats. Enjoy an authentic lunch at a local restaurant and browse the artisan and community area, complete with games and hand-painted posters. End your day by watching one of the world's most beautiful sunsets aboard a catamaran on Cartagena's bay. A truly romantic and unforgettable experience. (Overnight Cartagena)
Hablamos pronto, safe travels home, and visit again soon! We’ll have transport waiting to take you to the airport at your desired time.
